H0.text: A volcano erupts in the state of Washington is an example of a transfer of energy from the atmosphere to the lithosphere, illustrating Earth’s engine model and its heat‑exchange system.

H1.text: An earthquake taking place off the coast of Japan is an example of a transfer of energy from the atmosphere to the lithosphere in the Earth's engine system.

H2.text: A wild fire that scorches a prairie in the upper Midwest is an example of a transfer of energy from the atmosphere to the lithosphere, illustrating Earth’s engine heat‑exchange system.

H3.text: A hurricane moving from the Gulf of Mexico onto land is an example of a transfer of energy from the atmosphere to the lithosphere, as part of Earth's engine and heat exchange system.
